STEEPED IN.Definition: completely surrounded by or involved in

HANDCUFFED.Definition: having two metal rings around their wrists holding them together

PEN.Definition: an area surrounded by a barrier

BARBED WIRING.Definition: wire with sharp points on it

INSTINCTIVELY.Definition: in a way that is not planned or thought about

STARE.Definition: look in a fixed way with eyes wide open

SHADY.Definition: of doubtful legality, suspicious or questionable

ENCLAVE.Definition: a part of a country that is surrounded by another country

STRIKE A BLOW.Definition: do something that would hurt them

TURNS OUT.Definition: seems to be the case, happens

SOVEREIGNTY.Definition: the power to control its government

INTERROGATED.Definition: asked questions or forced to give answers

MESH.Definition: material made of a network of wire

DETAINEES.Definition: the people that were kept there

INTERROGATION.Definition: the process of asking questions for a long time in order to get information

AMOUNT TO.Definition: be the same as, result in

SENSORY DEPRIVATION.Definition: a state of not having anything to sense or feel, isolation

CROUCH.Definition: stay in a low position by bending the knees

TORTURE-FILLED.Definition: full of practices that caused them mental and physical pain

LIMBO.Definition: an uncertain period of waiting for a decision

CONDEMNATION.Definition: the expression of very strong disapproval

AHEAD OF THE CURVE.Definition: the first who had referred to it

DETAINMENT.Definition: the state of being kept in prison

DEHUMANISING.Definition: taking away the good human qualities

DETAINEE.Definition: for the people who were kept in prison

SLOGAN.Definition: a short easily remembered phrase used to advertise his campaign

INDEFINITELY.Definition: for an unlimited or unspecified period of time

ABANDONMENT.Definition: the act of leaving it behind

INMATES.Definition: people who were kept in prison

MASTERMIND.Definition: the one who had planned and organised it

ALLY.Definition: country that has agreed to help and support them against a common enemy
